extendedIngredients.name: non-dairy creamer
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 cup dairy-free creamer (such as So Delicious Original Coconut Milk “Creamer”)
metaInformation: (such as So Delicious Original Coconut Milk “Creamer”)

extendedIngredients.name: milk
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 cup unsweetened milk alternative (such as So Delicious Unsweetened Coconut Milk Beverage)
metaInformation: (such as So Delicious Coconut Milk Beverage)

extendedIngredients.name: pineapple
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1-1/2 cups crushed fresh or canned pineapple with juice (I used fresh)

extendedIngredients.name: unsweetened coconut flakes
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/2 cup medium fine unsweetened coconut flakes.

recipes.title: Pina Colada Ice Cream

winePairing.pairingText: Port, Moscato d'Asti, and Cream Sherry are my top picks for Frozen Dessert. A common wine pairing rule is to make sure your wine is sweeter than your food. Delicate desserts go well with Moscato d'Asti, nutty desserts with cream sherry, and caramel or chocolate desserts pair well with port.

productMatches.title: St. Barthelemy Cellars Merlot Port
productMatches.description: With its bright and shimmering regal red color, the Merlot port is pleasing to the eye. Soft legs cling to the glass and the nose conjures up nougat and caramel with a hint of blackberry. A smooth mouth-feel gives way to a burst of spice while hints of licorice and blackberry are followed by a finish of almonds. Enjoy this delightful port with pâtés, chèvre and nutty cheeses.

recipes.instructions: In a food processor crush the fresh or canned pineapple and transfer to a bowlBlend together all other ingredients, except coconut flakes with hand mixer, blender or food processor and then mix with crushed pineapple.Transfer mixture into an ice cream maker, add 1/2 cup coconut flakes, and freeze according to your ice cream maker’s instructions.Enjoy as a soft serve, or scoop into a container and harden ice cream for scooping later.

steps.step: In a food processor crush the fresh or canned pineapple and transfer to a bowl
Blend together all other ingredients, except coconut flakes with hand mixer, blender or food processor and then mix with crushed pineapple.

Transfer mixture into an ice cream maker, add 1/2 cup coconut flakes, and freeze according to your ice cream maker’s instructions.Enjoy as a soft serve, or scoop into a container and harden ice cream for scooping later.
